abstract: Children’s Place, which runs the Disney Store chain, said its former C.E.O. left “at the request of the board” and described improper conduct involving “securities trades.”
snippet: Children’s Place, which runs the Disney Store chain, said its former C.E.O. left “at the request of the board” and described improper conduct involving “securities trades.”
lead_paragraph: When the board of Children’s Place ousted its chief executive, Ezra Dabah, several weeks ago over supposed violations of the company’s code of conduct, the clothing retailer assumed he would leave quietly.

headline.main: Ousted Chief of Retailer Strikes Back at Directors
headline.print_headline: Ousted Chief Of Retailer Strikes Back At Directors
